Activity: Check email for responses to the needs assessment questionnaire and any related inquiries.
Continue compiling the list of staff members involved in influenza data collection. Verify names and roles with HR to ensure accuracy.
Meet with @his-1 and @his-2 to discuss the data collection process and potential challenges in identifying relevant staff. Gain insights into the data flow and reporting requirements.
Update the staff list based on the meeting with @his-1 and @his-2. Ensure that all relevant roles are included, even those indirectly involved in the data collection process.
Begin drafting initial learning objectives for the training program. Focus on knowledge and skills related to data collection, EHR use, and data analysis.
Lunch break. Listen to some podcast about productivity tips.

Continue drafting learning objectives. Consider Bloom's Taxonomy to ensure that the objectives are measurable and aligned with different levels of learning (e.g., knowledge, comprehension, application, analysis).
Review the responses to the needs assessment questionnaire that have been submitted so far. Identify common themes and areas where staff members express a lack of confidence or understanding.
Contact @ehrv-1 to discuss any planned updates or changes to the EHR system that may impact the training program. Ensure that the training materials are aligned with the latest version of the system.
Refine the learning objectives based on the preliminary review of the needs assessment responses. Ensure that the objectives address the identified knowledge and skill gaps.
